Description: Eggshell ware, wheelmade Nile silt bowl with a carinated body. Pale red slip, with cream-beige paint on the upper half of the exterior (above the carination) and on the interior rim, running down on one side into the base of the pot. Incised line 7mm below the rim. Decorated with a brown painted band, filled with rough painted hatching evoking a woven pattern featuring squares at angles with each other, with on average 7 lines in each group.
Bibliographic references: Adams 1986 / Ceramic Industries of Medieval Nubia, Part I, Part II (Figure 26) (Type C13)
